articles.headline: Ukraine Reports Russian Invasion on a New Front
articles.snippet: Tanks, artillery and infantry have crossed from Russia into an unbreached part of eastern Ukraine in recent days, in what Ukrainian and Western military officials are calling a stealth invasion.
articles.abstract: Tanks, artillery and infantry have crossed from Russia into an unbreached part of eastern Ukraine in recent days, in what Ukrainian and Western military officials are calling a stealth invasion.
articles.lead_paragraph: DONETSK, Ukraine — Determined to preserve the pro-Russian revolt in eastern Ukraine, Russia reinforced what Western and Ukrainian officials described as a stealth invasion on Wednesday, sending armored troops across the border as it expanded the conflict to a new section of Ukrainian territory.
articles.byline: By Andrew E. Kramer and Michael R. Gordon

articles.headline: A 9-Year-Old at a Shooting Range, a Spraying Uzi and Outrage
articles.snippet: After a girl from New Jersey accidentally killed her instructor at a shooting range in Arizona, her parents’ cellphone video caused a worldwide spectacle.
articles.abstract: After a girl from New Jersey accidentally killed her instructor at a shooting range in Arizona, her parents’ cellphone video caused a worldwide spectacle.
articles.lead_paragraph: WHITE HILLS, Ariz. — The four-hour tours offered by one of the big gun ranges here are a popular tourist attraction. Starting at $200 a person, a bus will pick up visitors at their hotel in Las Vegas, 25 miles to the north, show them Hoover Dam and bring them to a recreational shooting range called Last Stop, where they can fire the weapons of their dreams: automatic machine guns, sniper rifles, grenade launchers. A hamburger lunch is included; a helicopter tour of the nearby Grand Canyon is optional.
articles.byline: By Kimberley McGee and Fernanda Santos

articles.headline: Lending Club, Middleman for Small Loans, Plans Stock Offering
articles.snippet: Lending Club, which has political heavyweights on its board and has raised money from the likes of Google, could rank among the 10 biggest I.P.O.s of an Internet company.
articles.abstract: Lending Club, which has political heavyweights on its board and has raised money from the likes of Google, could rank among the 10 biggest I.P.O.s of an Internet company.
articles.lead_paragraph: Updated, 8:19 p.m. | Obtaining a loan was once a matter of heading down to the bank and applying. But the technology boom of the last decade has given rise to a new way, where web-savvy investors can connect directly with would-be borrowers.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: The Future Could Work, if We Let It
articles.snippet: A book offers an optimistic view of the effects of technology, but its arguments have one big blind spot: human behavior.
articles.abstract: A book offers an optimistic view of the effects of technology, but its arguments have one big blind spot: human behavior.
articles.lead_paragraph: One persistent criticism of the tech industry is that it no longer works on big ideas. For all of Silicon Valley’s talk of changing the world, critics say, Google and Facebook mainly hire armies of coders to figure out how to serve you more relevant ads, while Apple and Amazon just want to keep selling you new stuff.

articles.headline: JPMorgan and Other Banks Struck by Hackers
articles.snippet: The hackers stole gigabytes of data, including account information. It is not yet clear if the attacks were financially motivated or part of a cyberespionage campaign.
articles.abstract: The hackers stole gigabytes of data, including account information. It is not yet clear if the attacks were financially motivated or part of a cyberespionage campaign.
articles.lead_paragraph: A number of United States banks, including JPMorgan Chase and at least four others, were struck by hackers in a series of coordinated attacks this month, according to four people briefed on a continuing investigation into the crimes.

articles.headline: Plugged-In Over Preppy: Teenagers Favor Tech Over Clothes
articles.snippet: For teenage apparel retailers, screen-obsessed youth pose a threat in the back-to-school sales season.
articles.abstract: For teenage apparel retailers, screen-obsessed youth pose a threat in the back-to-school sales season.
articles.lead_paragraph: For some teenagers, wearing last season’s jeans will always be unthinkable.
articles.byline: By Elizabeth A. Harris and Rachel Abrams

articles.headline: Military Skill and Terrorist Technique Fuel Success of ISIS
articles.snippet: As fighters continue to seize territory, the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria has built an effective management structure of mostly middle-aged Iraqis, including many military officers under Saddam Hussein.
articles.abstract: As fighters continue to seize territory, the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria has built an effective management structure of mostly middle-aged Iraqis, including many military officers under Saddam Hussein.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD — As fighters for the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria continue to seize territory, the group has quietly built an effective management structure of mostly middle-aged Iraqis overseeing departments of finance, arms, local governance, military operations and recruitment.
articles.byline: By Ben Hubbard and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: Medal of Honor for a Civil War Hero 150 Years in the Grave
articles.snippet: More than 150 years after standing his ground against Pickett’s Charge at the Battle of Gettysburg, Lt. Alonzo H. Cushing will be posthumously awarded the Medal of Honor by President Obama.
articles.abstract: More than 150 years after standing his ground against Pickett’s Charge at the Battle of Gettysburg, Lt. Alonzo H. Cushing will be posthumously awarded the Medal of Honor by President Obama.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — He went off to fight, telling a cousin that “I may never return” but “I will gain a name in this war.” First Lt. Alonzo H. Cushing proved right on both counts. He did not return, and now, after an epic delay notable even in a town famed for taking its time, his name will at long last be honored at the White House.

articles.headline: Expansion of Mental Health Care Hits Obstacles
articles.snippet:
The Affordable Care Act has prompted one of the
largest expansions of mental health coverage in a
generation, increasing access for millions, but shortfalls persist.
articles.abstract:
The Affordable Care Act has prompted one of the
largest expansions of mental health coverage in a
generation, increasing access for millions, but shortfalls persist.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOUISVILLE, Ky. — Terri Hall’s anxiety was back, making her hands shake as she tried to light a cigarette on the stoop of her faded apartment building. She had no appetite, and her mind galloped as she grasped for an answer to her latest setback.
